column4: hi guys, just installed my graphics card ( nvidia GeForce7600GT) and want to install the official drivers, which do i need?
fiesty?
yes
ok ill try it
it says i have no hardware that need restricted drivers
look at your xorg.conf and see if its using the nvidia driver
>_< sorry im new to ubuntu, how do i check xorg.conf in terminal?
sudo nano /etc/X11/xorg.conf
it mentions the name of my old GFX card (nv5m64) instead
you want to google 'ubuntu guide', look at the Edgy one, it will have a section on installing latest nvidia driver
would 'sudo apt-get install nvidia-glx-new' work?
consult the guide I referred to
ok
i just tried that command and it is asking for the feisty fawn cd, i installed it by updating not cd =/
did you read what I asked you to consult?
i am now :P
i cannot help you, if you dont help yourself
again its asking for c

ubuntu guide
